availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred C. Cope (Breathitt County & 5th KY Infy CSA)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer. Perry County, Kentucky, native. Father of Elizabeth E. Cope and Mary D. Cope. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1850 and 1860. Commissioned Lieutenant Colonel of the Breathitt County, Kentucky, enrolled militia on December 19, 1860. Commissioned a captain in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C. S. A.) in Jackson, Kentucky, on October 9, 1862.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District No. 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District No. 1, p. 117; KYR-0001-017-0039; Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 228-29.
